intro: Myrsine fusca, commonly known as the rough myrsine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes. Myrsine fusca is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and undergrowth.
